raw: * Container, which provides scrolling in one dimension (vertical or horizontal).
* @childControl button-forward {qx.ui.form.RepeatButton} button to step forward
* @childControl button-backward {qx.ui.form.RepeatButton} button to step backward
* @childControl content {qx.ui.container.Composite} container to hold the content
* @childControl scrollpane {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollPane} the scroll pane holds the content to enable scrolling
* *Example*
* Here is a little example of how to use the widget.
* <pre class='javascript'>
*   // create slide bar container
*   slideBar = new qx.ui.container.SlideBar().set({
*     width: 300
*   // set layout
*   slideBar.setLayout(new qx.ui.layout.HBox());
*   // add some widgets
*   for (var i=0; i<10; i++)
*     slideBar.add((new qx.ui.core.Widget()).set({
*       backgroundColor : (i % 2 == 0) ? "red" : "blue",
*       width : 60
*   this.getRoot().add(slideBar);
*
* This example creates a SlideBar and add some widgets with alternating
* background colors. Since the content is larger than the container, two
* scroll buttons at the left and the right edge are shown.
* *External Documentation*
* <a href='http://qooxdoo.org/docs/#desktop/widget/slidebar.md' target='_blank'>
* Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo manual.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Container, which provides scrolling in one dimension (vertical or horizontal).

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: content {qx.ui.container.Composite} container to hold the content

@childControl.name: @childControl

* @param options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.
* @return {qx.ui.core.Widget} This object (for chaining support)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

raw: * Returns the index position of the given item if it is
* a child item. Otherwise it returns -1.
* This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
* (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
* layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
* ignore the children order for the layout process.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to query for
* @return {Integer} The index position or -1 when
*   the given item is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given item if it is a child item. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.

raw: * Add a child at the specified index
* This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers
* (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional
* layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid})
* ignore the children order for the layout process.
* @param child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add
* @param index {Integer} Index, at which the item will be inserted
* @param options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a child at the specified index This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

raw: * Set a layout manager for the widget. A a layout manager can only be connected
* with one widget. Reset the connection with a previous widget first, if you
* like to use it in another widget instead.
* @param layout {qx.ui.layout.Abstract} The new layout or
* null to reset the layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set a layout manager for the widget. A a layout manager can only be connected with one widget. Reset the connection with a previous widget first, if you like to use it in another widget instead.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: layout {qx.ui.layout.Abstract} The new layout or null to reset the layout.
